reviews.sentence: Another great stay. Our family are regular guests at this hotel and we really enjoy the larger sized rooms and consistently friendly and professional staff. We always sleep well and the breakfast buffet is a reasonable price with lots of healthy and kid friendly options. The workout room is perfect for all of us adults and teens included. This time our trip brought us to Toronto for a very sad funeral hotel staff went out of their way to add on an extra layer of kindness and consideration. We all appreciated it very much. Main downside the outdoor pool is only open in the summer meaning that in winter there is not much on the premises besides screens and or ping pong to keep kids occupied for more than a short while.

noisy neighbor. everything was fine except our neighbor was extremely loud and was partying. we had to call the front desk at 345 AM and have security knock on their door and tell them to quiet down. location wonderful grounds.

Nice Hotel Terrible Staff. Hotel is beautiful. What I expected from a Westin. But staff is terrible. One staff member tells me one thing and another does another. I would never return or recommend just on this. I was going to tell manager but staff probably does what manager trains them on. Enough said.

Generally good hotel a bit different than most Westin hotels. This hotel used to be part of the Japanese Prince Hotel chain hence the Prince name stays. It definitely has an Asian theme to is in many places which is nice but somewhat out of place for the location in NE Toronto. I stay there frequently due to the proximity to offices where I visit. I am not sure why else someone would stay there unles some function is held there or nearby relatives. The rooms are quite large and very clean. I am usually placed in the tower where most rooms have excellent windows overlooking the direction you get. I think there is 1 interior room for every corner room. so lots of windows. Ask for a corner room if you want a better view. Bathroom are reasonably modern although there are some paint starting to peel in the damp areas. There is a shower beside the bathtub although the shower is quite small as I tend to hit my elbows periodically on the walls or glass. Not a big deal unles you are a really big person. The bar area is reasonably nice and bartenders have been quite good I have eaten in the main restaurant beside the bar and I find the dinner food is very fresh and generally very good not cheap though. Breakfast for me has been the buffet which has the standard fare for a Westin lots of fruit some berries usual sausage links bacon etc. They have an omelette station too. Service in the restaurant is not too special they could use improvement there. Generally English is not the primary language and not all are easy to understand. They are also sort of connected to a Japanese restaurant which is a nice change. I have not used the outdoor pool or tennis courts. Not many use them by the looks of it.
You have to pay for parking 12 I was asked to pay for internet no breakfast. I checked in Saturday evening and only two girls working at the front desk. then imagine the waiting time.

do not use for an event. We were there for a conference. The hotel property was adequate. It is located conveniently to the DVP so it is easy to get to. However there is really nothing near it. If you are in Toronto for leisure you do not want to be here. But really the biggest mark against it from a service level they were totally unprepared to handle our conference needs. Coffee stations inadequately serviced during our scheduled breaks. An inordinately long time for food service at our gala. A dismissive attitude when one of our table mates indicated that they had a severe allergy. A bar with only one bartender scheduled for a two hour break in our program they knew our timing. The bar on our last night there closing at midnight basically losing our on thousands of dollars in business. We also had issues with the billing of our rooms but that was more to do with Westin corporate rather than the the hotel itself. On a positive note the front desk staff were excellent the room was clean the park like setting was very nice and the lobby beautiful. But given their issues with our event and the fact that there really is not anything exciting around it I would not recommend this hotel.

Cleanliness Issues. This used to be my go to hotel in Toronto friendly staff clean rooms access to 401. DVPJanuary saw me stay 7 nights at the Westin Prince. Last stay was January 26th to January 31st. Recent Stay Isues1st Room booked King but only 2 double beds available hotel was sold out was upgraded to Deluxe Room though stayed 3 nights in this rom2nd Rom1st request to housekeeping to provide new pillow case went unansweredBathrom sink had previous guests soap stuck on side of sink when housekeeping was notified no one showed upPlunger on sink open close drain. was broken3rd RomOne side of pillow case wine stained pink from wine about 13rd of pilow Bathroom shower had black mold on back ledge beside bathtub that ran up glass 12 inch wide and 34 1 inch highDesk lamp did not function. All issues manager came up to room and verified conditions. Points for 3 nights making the Green Choice not applied to account. There were a few other issues but were professionally resolved and exceeded expectations in resolution. Cleanliness and Housekeeping issues were not resolved. It appears this hotel is going through some sort of transition perhaps to a budget no frills and are trying to cut costs at the expense of cleanliness and housekeeping responsiveness. Perhaps this is because of the recent purchase by Mariot and although independently owned need to cut costs. I have 5 upcoming nights in Toronto and I have booked elsewhere. It will be a while before I stay here again which is a shame the staff are friendly and welcoming.

Exceptional Service. I can not say enough good things about the service at the Westin Prince in North York ONThe welcoming experience begins with the lovely valet gents who make every effort to get to know your routine offer you a warm hello each morning. The front desk staff know me by name always have my room points taken care of including my go green option. They truly appreciate your business loyalty feels rewarded. This location has a great workout facility as well and nice grounds for walking when the weather cooperates.

Happy customer. Room needed upgrading considering how nice the entrance is you would think the bathroom would not have cracked and flaking paint and caulking around tub starting to pull from tub. There was no patio set to sit on outside on belcony but it looked like the balcony needed work too. With that being said the room was comfortable. I enjoyed my very brief stay. I was there for business and everything else closer to Toronto was like 60 a night so for being a quick 20 minute drive to where I was going I was happy with what I got. Room service had breakfast ready for me at exactly 8 am even though the card said between 8 and 815 it would arrive So I was very happy with that. Pool was cold. Considering how hot toronto has been this year they must be pumping seriously cold water into it. 9 pm at night and I was shivering in the pool when it felt like 34c in the air around the pool.
Clean. Good room but the restaurant service is slow and it is really expensive. Good places across the street though.

Very nice stay. I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference in the area. The hotel itself exceeded my expectations. It was a very nice clean hotel with great dining options. My room was clean the bathroom was clean and the staff was very helpful throughout. It was about a 20 minute drive into downtown. I had an incident where I burned my finger. While the staff was very helpful in getting me ice it would be nice for the hotel to carry some basic first aid supplies for a small incident like mine. That would be my only recommendation. Other than that great hotel.

Great Customer Service Overcomes All. Stayed at the property as part of conference. Even though I arrived long before check in time the front desk staff got me a room. Room service was swift although typical hotel overpriced. My lunch arrived within 20 minutes of order and the food was hot and plentiful. On the 2nd day of my stay discovered that i could not receive any incoming calls. My maintenance man Mani was quick to diagnose that one of the phone lines had been cut by the group doing street repairs. MANI was extremely apologetic and offered to have my room moved. When I told him that this was unnecessary since I only had night left he promised some sort of compensation for my inconvenience. later in the day Mani showed up with a comp breakfast certificate and later the manager Krisandrasent me a handwritten note and chocolates. further apologizing. Problems aside this is a great hotel with great food and service. I highly recommend.
Top shelf service. Fantastic. Top rate service. Would stay again and again.

lovely modern hotel with good amenities. Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Got a good rate by calling the hotel directly. Unfortunately they did not tell me that parking was not included in the rate. Since the hotel is not near an airport or any other major form of transportation I would guess that most guests have their own vehicles and having to pay for parking would be something they could have informed me about when making my reservation. Beyond that hotel is lovely and staff attentive. Food in the Restaurant Lobby Bar was excellent. Staff in the Lobby Bar were very nice. Food plaza across the street was sort of handy. Doing business in the area so location was ideal could not open slider in my room on the 11th floor even just a bit for some fresh air. Floor to ceiling corner windows are very nice.

2nd Property Review Improved. Traveled to the GTA on business again and decided to give this hotel another try. Was greeted on arrival by friendly associates at the front desk who were attentive. Much to my surprise I provided a complimentary upgrade to a higher floor. The bathroom appeared to be the only area of the room that had been remodeled but the changes were nice. Hans Groh bath fixtures throughout with a rain shower shower head made for a luxurious shower experience. Bath amenities were run of the mill nothing spectacular. The remainder of the room appeared as others I have stayed in at this property wallpaper coming off the wall in places desk and wardrobe are fairly old and worn. Hopefully these will be replaced as a part of their remodel plans. Common areas of the hotel are spectacular and are what can be expected of a Westin property. One disappointment again is the pace of service in the bar on the lobby level. SLOW beyond belief. Sat for 10 minutes not acknowledged even though a server walked by several time. Finally decided to just stand and order pay immediately and take it to my room. Takes forever to get the check. Always seem to be out of Stella Artois and other beers on tap or something is wrong with the tap or some other excuse. Breakfast buffet in the mornings is very good and offers both healthy and alternate options. All delicious. Service in the restaurant is consistent with Westins high standards. Checkout is quick and efficient. The lifts elevators are slow and directional arrows evidently do not work on all floors as guests wanting to go down were hopping on not realizing it was going the opposite direction. Some mentioned the arrows were not working.
The staff the location the Fox and Fiddle next door and the lobby stood out to us. The bathroom did not have a ceiling fan.
Attended to meet a friend for dinner. Great easy parking. Staff was friendly and taxi are waiting at the front for pick up.
Excellent staff immaculate rooms and great location.

Solid place to stay. Stayed here for one night in June 2018. Read all the reviews ahead of time. I was very satisfied with my stay. Without asking I was given a complimentary upgraded room and was pleasantly greeted. Room was modern and comfortable. Was emailed ahead of my visit by Paul from the Westin Experience Specialist welcoming me to the hotel and inquiring if I needed any assistance which I did not. I had a minor issue and did reach out to him by email after I had checked in. He promptly emailed me back and offered his assistance. This was on a Friday night even. Excellent service by Paul. Had breakfast in the restaurant and it was excellent as well. Beautiful hotel with great service. I recommend anyone and everyone to stay here.

will not go back. Very disappointing. Many guests stayed at this hotel for a wedding we were attending. The front desk staff was not welcoming at all. Gave no info about the hotel. Many people did not receive the type of room that had been booked months in advance and were told they were not available. There were 2 of 3 elevators operating very slowly and then only one. Waited in the heat in the hallway for over 12 hour before squeezing on and being met with rude comments by other guests. The ice machine did not work. The heavy hook fell off the bathroom door. One robe was provided for a 2 guest room. Some received no bath products while others hit the jackpot with one shampoo and conditioner for a 2 night stay. Have been given the runaround concerning billing. Ate at Seasons. Very nice ambience and the food was very good although the service was slow. This hotel is in a convenient location.

A very enjoyable stay. I was somewhat put off initially by the location of this hotel which was on the far side of Toronto and quite a drive when coming from the west. That said I liked the setting in a park and the parking areas were easy to access and carefully controlled. The hotel ’s entrance areas are spacious and airy with a large and comfortable lounge area. I was impressed with my room and its corner window with an unimpeded view. The housekeeping staff were very helpful and polite. The conference area was well designed several groups were holding meetings concurrently but the spaces never felt crowded. The conference food was very good and plentiful with some little twists that put it above the usual bland fare. I had no time to try the outdoor pool but it looked inviting. I had dinner at Gilaneh restaurant in the grounds which was excellent I ’ve reviewed it separately. I would definitely stay at this hotel if were convenient for downtown Toronto I did n’t check what the transit options are but I would not fancy driving downtown from there. It is certainly convenient for the Aga Khan Museum and the Science Centre.
Great reception nice lobby clean rooms and conveniently located near loads of restaurants.
Wonderful hotel with awesome service.

Great Service. The restaurant and bar staff are amazingly friendly people and always do such a wonderful job. Particularly Terry Theresa and Tricia. They always take the time to say hello walk around and say hi to everyone that is a regular at the hotel and always provide excellent service. Thank you Terry Theresa and Tricia for all that you do.
pool only outdoor. Pool and tennis court needed a refresh. Staff was particularly helpful and willing to please.
